name: Pullman Auckland

reviews.title: Great stay at Pullman Residences
reviews.text: Stayed two nights in the residences tower. Great room with lovely harbour veiws. Great service
Will stay here again
reviews.title: Excellent apartment with fantastic views

reviews.text: Friends stayed in the older bock at the same time which was nice with nice harbour view but it is definitely work the extra to stay in the residences tower.
reviews.title: All around great experience

reviews.text: We stayed within a two bedroom apartment for a week in July and found the Pullman to be one of the nicest luxury suites we have stayed in. The harbour view balcony was fantastic and it was great watching the sun-rise over the volcanos in the distance.
reviews.title: Nice & Handy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The modern furniture and equipment were wonderful. The pool was great for the kids and buffet breakfast was a nice treat to help us get over the jet-jag.
reviews.title: You must see the pool

reviews.text: I visited the Pullman today for a conference, and tried to park in the Wilson carpark beneath the hotel. There were no free parks left, so after 5 mins of driving around I went to leave only to find I was being charged for the pleasure of just driving in. Unable to contact the carparking company, I went and spoke to the hotel. These guys were incredibly helpful, and arranged for my car to be park, and validated my parking ticket for me. All i wanted was to get out of the carpark, so this service was totally above and beyond what i was expecting. When I went to leave, one of the concierge escorted me to my car, and opened the door for me. Huge thanks to the staff there, next time I need a hotel in Auckland I will definitely come to you. Top service.
reviews.title: Best customer service I've had in ages

reviews.text: We have stayed here twice because we were attending conferences. Great bed and nice quiet rooms. The bar is nice and we were able to have restaurant meals there which were very good. Although when I asked if my meal was gluten free the waitress never returned to confirm, they just served it up. I took the risk and was okay but shouldn't have to ask twice. The rooms are tired and shabby and bathrooms urgently need modernising although the furnishings make the best of the situation. Cleanliess is adequate for an older establishment.
reviews.title: Okay if you are not paying 5 star prices

reviews.text: Conference rooms and outer spaces are great, good acoustics however the loud music from the conference next door was very distracting. And the hotel chose to test their fire alarms 3 times 5-10 minutes apart during the middle of sessions which had to stop. Could the conference organisers not have been warned so they could organise breaks at this time? Additionally the lunch was not ready on time, little variety and there wasn't enough for the numbers.
reviews.title: They simply got everything perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's okay and the staff are friendly - just don't expect 5 star.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star level

reviews.text: Im a difficult guest at the best of times. I know what i like and and i'm not shy of making my thoughts known if i don't get it. But i could not fault my recent stay at The Pullman hotel in Auckland. From the very efficient & cheerful concierge who opened my taxi door and then promised to have my bags in my room before i get there, to the charming and friendly front desk staff who made me feel like i was returning home after a long trip, it was perfection. I loved the lobby, Very attractive use of colour and stylish furniture & fixtures, without being tacky or ostentatious. My check in was fast and i was certain that i would reach my room before my bags, and i was already planning a "you were saying..?" to the concierge that was almost certainly in another lift on his way up with my luggage. I was in room 1408 on the top floor. I opened the door and was immediately surprised by the size of the room. Large and well appointed with a guest bathroom near the door, and all the comforts that you would expect in a 5 star property. Coffee is an essential item for me. I NEED it as soon as i wake and also throughout the afternoon if im working in my room, so it was with delight i see a top of the range Nespresso machine on the desk with a supply of pods. Nice touch. The king size bed looked very inviting and i was glad the Pullman has not adopted the annoying practice of having 45 pillows and cushions on the bed that some hotels in Europe i have recently stayed in, Ipod dock in the room was great for charging and playing my tunes while i unpacked (nice quality sound by the way, but i cant recall the brand of the dock).
reviews.title: Always Great !

reviews.text: Stayed here on business.
reviews.title: Good for business or leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was fast and efficient except my loyalty number dropped from the booking and was never able to get it added by the hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great views!!

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom a little odd design but was functional.
reviews.title: Fantastic service, attentive staff

reviews.text: Air conditioning worked well and was quiet. Room was also quiet (was at end of corridor). At times the key card door entry system was a little temperamental.
reviews.title: Could be great but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was good with an extensive range and eggs cooked to order. The room did get crowded in peak times but was always able to get a seat.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at the Pullman.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The location is set in a relatively quiet area near the AUT. Queen Street, the CBD and the Custom Street waterfront area are only a short walk away.
reviews.title: at last a reasonable price on WiFi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy. The check in staff and valet staff was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Not what it says it is

reviews.text: We were in a standard room on the 10th floor looking out towards the harbour.
reviews.title: Quality and care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room wasn’t overly large, but was still comfy enough for my wife and me. The bed was very comfortable with a good selection of pillows. There is a comfy lounge chair next to the bed and a small work desk and chair. The only issue I had with bedroom area was the lack of power points near the bed and bedside cabinets. Other than that everything was great.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

description: With its stunning views of Auckland harbour and the city’s parks, Pullman Auckland offers guests a visual treat as well as a very warm welcome. Conveniently located in the heart of the city, the hotel provides easy access to Auckland’s numerous attractions, including the beautiful Albert Park and vibrant, cosmopolitan Viaduct.
